## Objectives

1.  Create a scatterplot using the `ggplot()` function.

2.  Interpret the relationship between variables in a scatterplot.

3.  Refine and improve scatterplots to illustrate relevant points by preprocessing the data or using functions such as `alpha()` and `geom_jitter()`.

## Reading

[Chapter 2 - 2.3](https://moderndive.com/2-viz.html#needed-packages)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Plot to use for this problem.
ggplot(data = alaska_flights, mapping = aes(x = dep_delay, y = arr_delay)) + 
  geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Figure 1: Arrival delays versus departure delays for Alaska Airlines flights from NYC in 2013.](Student-notes-lesson-02_files/figure-html/noalpha-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Second Plot to use for this problem.

  geom_point(alpha = 0.2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Figure 2: Arrival vs. departure delays scatterplot with alpha = 0.2](Student-notes-lesson-02_files/figure-html/alpha-1.png){width=672}
:::
